jsimple.net

Class JavaHttpResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsimple.lang.AutoCloseable
      • jsimple.net.HttpResponse
        • jsimple.net.JavaHttpResponse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class JavaHttpResponse
extends HttpResponse
    Java platform implementation of platform independent HttpResponse. This implementation is basically a wrapper around the response part of HttpURLConnection.
    Since:
    10/6/12 12:58 AM

    • Method Detail

      • getStatusCode

        public int getStatusCode()
        Description copied from class: HttpResponse
        Gets the status code from an HTTP response message (e.g. 200, 401, etc.). Returns -1 if no code can be discerned from the response (i.e., the response is not valid HTTP).
        Specified by:
        getStatusCode in class HttpResponse
        Returns:
        the HTTP Status-Code, or -1

      • getStatusMessage

        public java.lang.String getStatusMessage()
        Description copied from class: HttpResponse
        Gets the message from the HTTP response status line--the "reason phrase" (which is what the RFC calls it) describing the error that comes after the status code.
        Specified by:
        getStatusMessage in class HttpResponse
        Returns:
        the HTTP reason phrase, from the status line

      • getBodyStream

        public InputStream getBodyStream()
        Description copied from class: HttpResponse
        Returns an input stream that reads from this open connection.

        A SocketTimeoutException can be thrown when reading from the returned input stream if the read timeout expires before data is available for read.

        Specified by:
        getBodyStream in class HttpResponse
        Returns:
        an input stream that reads from this open connection
